Title: the status quo combustion

Leonard: How’s your mom holding up?
Okay. Well, now that everyone’s here, Penny and I have some big news. We’re engaged.
Hey, hey, what the hell?
Hey, buddy.
You okay?
That’s a rude thing to say, out loud.
Whatever you do, just don’t make any rash decisions.
Hi, Mom. I have some exciting news.
Before I tell you, will you promise to try and be happy for me and keep any concerns you have to yourself?
I hate that you talk to him more than you talk to me.
You know what? It’s probably fine.
I’m your son. What about the fact that she’s good enough for me?
Thanks, Mom.
Yes, it would.
What you working on?
Oh. How’s it going?
It’s nice that you called them esteemed.
So, listen, there was something I was hoping to float past you.
Now that Penny and I are engaged, I thought we might want to talk about our living arrangements.
I’m not.
Actually, this is about where she and I are going to live.
Well, well, we might want to live together.
That’s very sweet. But we were thinking more of us maybe living together with… not you.
Look, I, I know this is, this is change, and that sounds scary.
I don’t know. We just started to think about this. Maybe I’ll move in with Penny, or maybe she and I’ll take this place, and you can move across the hall.
No, I did not.
No.
Because I love Penny, and want to give her the life she deserves.
Well, yeah.
Well, you cook for me all the time and, ugh.
It’s hard to talk with so much heavy chewing to do.
I know you’ll try. So, should we talk about setting a date?
Okay. And when would that be?
No, I thought he was with you.
What happened?
Oh.
Well, he’s been having a couple of tough days. I’m sure he’s fine. He probably just needs a little alone time to decompress.
Anyway, as I was saying, Sheldon probably just needs a little alone time. ‘Cause that’s important. Not just for him, but for most anybody, really.
I haven’t heard from Sheldon in a while. You think he’s okay?
I’m gonna see where he is.
Oh, I know his password, so I can track his phone.
Not always, but ever since he wandered off at the swap meet chasing a balloon, I get worried.
That’s weird.
He’s at the train station.
It’s dark out and he’s alone, I don’t like it. Let’s go get him.
It’s not just that. My mother would kill me if I let something happen to him.
Sheldon.
Yeah.
Seriously? You don’t even have a change of clothes or a toothbrush.
Okay, I know you’re upset and there’s a lot of stuff going on, but it’s nothing we can’t work out. Come on, let’s get you home.
So a few things don’t go your way and your best decision is to ride the rails like a hobo?
Come on, come home with us and tomorrow I’ll, I’ll take you to Legoland.
Then what can I do?
Oh, come on, you know you’re overreacting.
What? Why?
You know he can’t take a trip like this by himself.
No, he looks like a grown man. You’ve seen Freaky Friday, sometimes little kids end up in big person bodies.
I know, but…
Sheldon, if you really need to do this, I’m not gonna stand in your way.
Okay. Good luck.
Bye, buddy. Sheldon?
I’m gonna miss you.
He just made that easier.
He’s okay?
Me, too. And he was able to take a sabbatical from…
Howard: She’s doing okay, but we just lost another nurse.
Two, and I know what you’re thinking, she’s eating them.
A bowl full of M&M’s with a few Ambien tossed in.
Because you had sex the other night?
You know, if you’re really serious about that, I hear there are some exciting opportunities in home care for the old and fat.
Oh, come on, give her a chance.
Yeah, maybe it’s time we just release Ma back into the sea.
Well, then, we may need to get used to the idea that we’re gonna be living here the next few months.
Well, what if we use our vacation time?
I don’t know what else we can do.
Don’t take this the wrong way, but did you do this for the insurance money?
Hang on. I know a place you can stay and earn some money at the same time.
I just have to warn you, it’ll involve humiliation, degradation and verbal abuse.
Amy: How many is that now?
Atomic magnets?
So, what are the living arrangements gonna be?
Well, with you not working, that makes financial sense.
They just don’t appreciate you.
Here, I made you some Strawberry Quik.
You know, this might work out for the best. I mean, you’re always complaining about what a terrible roommate Leonard is. Like how he turns up the thermostat when you’re not there.
You hate the sound of all those keys on his key chain.
See? Maybe you’ll love living alone.
And if it turns out you don’t, you and I could live together.
Sheldon, it was just a thought.
It tastes the same.
Hi, is Sheldon here?
He was, but he stormed off and now he isn’t answering his phone.
He was really angry that you suggested he move out.
I also mentioned that he and I could live together but he was too mad at you to realize what a great idea that is.
You’re probably right. So, what are you guys doing?
That’s nice.
Don’t I know it. What is that, polenta?
Right.
Actually sounds like he’s doing pretty well.
How could you let him go?
Bernadette: She’s just so impossible, they keep quitting.
You guys propose all the time. This never happens.
I know you’ve only been here a day and a half, but you’re like part of the family. I don’t think the service is gonna send any more people.
But we have jobs. We can’t baby-sit her 24 hours a day.
I wanted to go to Hawaii, not hell.
Howie, I love you, and as your wife, your mother is every bit as much my problem as she is yours, so, I want a divorce.
Sorry I’m late. The leaf blower broke, so I had to hand-dry my mother-in-law.
Thanks. Little warning before you jump into this marriage business. You’re not just marrying him, you’re marrying his family.
It doesn’t matter if she’s okay with you. The question is, can she go to the bathroom by herself? Hit me again.
You’re not working. How would you like a job in home health care?
I’ll pay you anything you want.
I could’ve ridden a bull longer than that.
So, she’s not too much for you?
Yeah. I don’t know why, but something about it feels unnatural.
Sheldon: So, who’s watching her now?
Hello.
I just got called into President Siebert’s office. The university won’t let me switch my field of study to inflationary cosmology. They’re forcing me to continue with string theory.

He said it’s why they hired me, it’s, it’s what my grant was designated for, and that everybody has to do things they don’t want to do. He then gave an example of something he had to do, even though he didn’t want to, which was look at my stupid face.
It’s an outrage. Honestly, I’m tempted to leave the university.
I don’t know. I am really aggravated.
I’m writing an appeal to the Faculty Senate, so that I can move on from string theory.

You tell me. Dear Esteemed Colleagues, as you may know, I have requested to change my field of study. My decision to do so is, I believe, in the best interest of science. At your convenience, I’d be happy to explain it to you in words you’ll understand.
You’re right. I’ll take that out.
Mm.
Of course. She’s spent many nights here, and you’re worried about preserving the myth of her virginity before the wedding.
Good, because not only has that ship sailed, if it hit an iceberg, countless men would perish.
What do you mean?

Oh, yeah, well, I’ve already given this some thought, and I’m willing to let Penny live with us one day a week for a trial period. Now, obviously, not when she’s made cranky by the shedding of her uterine lining.
I don’t understand. How could we all live together if I’m not there?
Where are you going to go?
Move across the hall? Did you take a marijuana?
Did you get hit on the head with a coconut?
Well, then, I’m all out of guesses. What? Me move across the hall. Why would you even suggest such a thing?
I see. You’re putting your future bride’s happiness above mine.
Wow.
How dare the university force me to go back to string theory?
Yeah, and on top of that, Leonard has the audacity to suggest that now that he and Penny are engaged, he may not want to live with me any more.
I have real problems here, Amy. I can’t be mollified with a beverage designed for children. Mmm, yummy.
Ugh, it’s like walking into the Amazon. And not the good Amazon with one-day shipping. The awful one with birds and snakes.
Four keys! Who does he think he is, a warden?
I don’t know. Perhaps.
You and… oh, sure, and while we’re at it, why don’t we get engaged, too? Why don’t we get a little house, start a family? Enjoy our sunset years together? Do you hear yourself, woman?

No. Here’s a thought. You’re not moving in, Leonard’s not moving out, everything stays exactly the way it is. And by the way, I saw you make this Strawberry Quik with syrup, you’re supposed to use the powder.
No. The syrup tastes better and I don’t like it.
No.
What happened?
And you couldn’t put it out?
So when will you reopen?
So, tomorrow?
Your life? The university is making me do string theory and my girlfriend loves me so much she wants to live with me. And now, the place I need to go when I’m sad is damp and smells funny.
No. I do not accept this. Everything is changing and I hate it. It stops now. I’m helping you get back on your feet. I would like to purchase this comic book, please.
Really? It’s soaking wet.
Can you break a twenty?
You know what? I don’t always recognize sarcasm, but I do right now, and I don’t appreciate it. I’m sorry for your loss. But you’re not the only one whose day has been a disaster.
You tracked my phone?
Boy, you chase one balloon for three miles.
Don’t be melodramatic. I’m just getting on a train and leaving forever.
My plan is to stop at malls and buy what I need. It’s called living off the land.
No. I’ve reached my breaking point. I need to leave. Now.
It doesn’t matter.
I suppose it is. Except I have a credit card. And I refuse to carry my laptop at the end of a stick. And I’d sooner die than eat beans out of a can.
Legoland is not the solution to everything. And it’s too much of a scene since that movie came out.
Leonard, I am overwhelmed. Everything is changing and it’s simply too much. I need to get away and think.
Good Lord. Padawan’s the student, not the teacher.
I do.
I will.
Yes?
Of course you are.
Raj: And I thought me having sex with Emily was gonna be the big news.
Boy, I’m so hungry today. I wonder why?
You know what? That may be it. By the way, it isn’t like riding a bike. Like, I fell off a few times.
When I’m feeling low, I have sex with a girl. But that’s just me.
We’re here for you, man. Whatever you need, okay?
Sure, of course. Oh, actually, Emily was gonna spend the night.
Well, I can’t take all the credit. She let me do it to her, but, uh, but I can always call her and cancel.
Penny: I think Leonard’s mom’s okay with me.
Well, haven’t really talked about it yet, but I figure at some point, I’ll move in with him, or he’ll move in with me.
This is so sweet. You never cook for me.
If you don’t like my cooking, why haven’t you ever said anything?
Well, I’d like to pick one that works with my brother’s schedule.
Uh, 12 to 18 months from now, depending on good behaviour.
Well, Leonard cooked for me and now we’re just having a nice dinner, you know, as a newly engaged couple.
He can take care of himself. Look, we went over stranger danger and gave him that whistle.
It’s sweet how you look out for him. You’re a good guy.
Leonard, hang on. Just come here. Maybe we need to let him go.
It might be good for him.
Leonard, we can’t protect him forever.
He’ll be okay. You taught him well, Padawan.
I really think this is gonna be for the best.
Nurse: No. Life, it is too short.
Mrs Hofstadter: No. Let me save you all of your hemming and hawing. Sheldon already told me that you and Penny are engaged.
Would you like for you and me to talk more?
In any event, while I’ve had my misgivings about Penny, Sheldon spoke very fondly of her, and if she is good enough for him, then she’s good enough for me.
Leonard, would it make you feel better to hear that your mother approved of your life choices?
Yeah. Well, you should work on that.
Penny (on phone): No, Mom, it’s the same guy I’ve been going out with for the past two years. Yeah, the scientist. Well, it’s complicated. I mean, he works with lasers and atomic magnets. No, I did not see it coming. No, we did not set a date. No, I am not pregnant. Yeah, this is a first for our family. All right, tell Dad I love him. I gotta go. All right, bye.
Stuart: Hey, Sheldon.
I was cooking in the back room last night and the hot plate caught on fire.
I was across the street at the do-it-yourself car wash, taking a shower.
Um, I don’t know. I’m waiting to hear back from the insurance company.
I don’t mean to be rude, Sheldon, but, uh, my life is kind of falling apart right now.
Well, sorry I let you down.
That’ll be $2.99.
Fine, a dollar.
No, I only have hundreds.
(Light falls on ground just where he was standing a moment before) That could have killed me. I can’t catch a break.
No. God, you sound like the police, the firemen, my parents, my therapist and the insurance company.
Uh, actually, I was wondering if I could crash at your place for a few nights.
You slept with her? Nice.
Great.
So what’s the catch?
Hey. What are you guys still doing here? I got this, go. Go home.
Yeah, she’s fed, she took her pills, she’s all tucked in and watching TV.
Are you kidding? I love her, she’s great.
Coming, Debbie.
She insisted. So, hey, guys, thank you so much. This job is a dream come true.
Mrs Wolowitz (off): Stewie, you gonna watch Wheel of Fortune with me?
Amy (on phone): Okay, Sheldon, thanks for checking in. Talk to you tomorrow? Oh, okay, bye.

I think Leonard’s mom’s okay with me.
It doesn’t matter if she’s okay with you. The question is, can she go to the bathroom by herself? Hit me again.
So, what are the living arrangements gonna be?
Well, haven’t really talked about it yet, but I figure at some point, I’ll move in with him, or he’ll move in with me.
Well, with you not working, that makes financial sense.
You’re not working. How would you like a job in home health care?
I’ll pay you anything you want.
I could’ve ridden a bull longer than that.
I’m writing an appeal to the Faculty Senate, so that I can move on from string theory.

It’s nice that you called them esteemed.
You’re right. I’ll take that out.
So, listen, there was something I was hoping to float past you.
Now that Penny and I are engaged, I thought we might want to talk about our living arrangements.
Of course. She’s spent many nights here, and you’re worried about preserving the myth of her virginity before the wedding.
Good, because not only has that ship sailed, if it hit an iceberg, countless men would perish.
Actually, this is about where she and I are going to live.
Well, well, we might want to live together.

That’s very sweet. But we were thinking more of us maybe living together with… not you.
I don’t understand. How could we all live together if I’m not there?
Look, I, I know this is, this is change, and that sounds scary.
Where are you going to go?
I don’t know. We just started to think about this. Maybe I’ll move in with Penny, or maybe she and I’ll take this place, and you can move across the hall.
Move across the hall? Did you take a marijuana?
Did you get hit on the head with a coconut?
Well, then, I’m all out of guesses. What? Me move across the hall. Why would you even suggest such a thing?
Because I love Penny, and want to give her the life she deserves.
I see. You’re putting your future bride’s happiness above mine.

Yeah, and on top of that, Leonard has the audacity to suggest that now that he and Penny are engaged, he may not want to live with me any more.
Here, I made you some Strawberry Quik.
I have real problems here, Amy. I can’t be mollified with a beverage designed for children. Mmm, yummy.
You know, this might work out for the best. I mean, you’re always complaining about what a terrible roommate Leonard is. Like how he turns up the thermostat when you’re not there.

See? Maybe you’ll love living alone.
And if it turns out you don’t, you and I could live together.
You and… oh, sure, and while we’re at it, why don’t we get engaged, too? Why don’t we get a little house, start a family? Enjoy our sunset years together? Do you hear yourself, woman?
Sheldon, it was just a thought.

No. Here’s a thought. You’re not moving in, Leonard’s not moving out, everything stays exactly the way it is. And by the way, I saw you make this Strawberry Quik with syrup, you’re supposed to use the powder.
No. The syrup tastes better and I don’t like it.
This is so sweet. You never cook for me.
Well, you cook for me all the time and, ugh.
If you don’t like my cooking, why haven’t you ever said anything?
It’s hard to talk with so much heavy chewing to do.
I know you’ll try. So, should we talk about setting a date?
Well, I’d like to pick one that works with my brother’s schedule.
Okay. And when would that be?
Uh, 12 to 18 months from now, depending on good behaviour.
No, I thought he was with you.
He was, but he stormed off and now he isn’t answering his phone.
He was really angry that you suggested he move out.
I also mentioned that he and I could live together but he was too mad at you to realize what a great idea that is.
Well, he’s been having a couple of tough days. I’m sure he’s fine. He probably just needs a little alone time to decompress.
You’re probably right. So, what are you guys doing?
Well, Leonard cooked for me and now we’re just having a nice dinner, you know, as a newly engaged couple.
Anyway, as I was saying, Sheldon probably just needs a little alone time. ‘Cause that’s important. Not just for him, but for most anybody, really.
Don’t I know it. What is that, polenta?
I was cooking in the back room last night and the hot plate caught on fire.
And you couldn’t put it out?
I was across the street at the do-it-yourself car wash, taking a shower.
Um, I don’t know. I’m waiting to hear back from the insurance company.
I don’t mean to be rude, Sheldon, but, uh, my life is kind of falling apart right now.
Your life? The university is making me do string theory and my girlfriend loves me so much she wants to live with me. And now, the place I need to go when I’m sad is damp and smells funny.
Well, sorry I let you down.
No. I do not accept this. Everything is changing and I hate it. It stops now. I’m helping you get back on your feet. I would like to purchase this comic book, please.
You know what? I don’t always recognize sarcasm, but I do right now, and I don’t appreciate it. I’m sorry for your loss. But you’re not the only one whose day has been a disaster.
(Light falls on ground just where he was standing a moment before) That could have killed me. I can’t catch a break.
I haven’t heard from Sheldon in a while. You think he’s okay?
I’m gonna see where he is.
Oh, I know his password, so I can track his phone.
Not always, but ever since he wandered off at the swap meet chasing a balloon, I get worried.
He can take care of himself. Look, we went over stranger danger and gave him that whistle.
It’s dark out and he’s alone, I don’t like it. Let’s go get him.
It’s sweet how you look out for him. You’re a good guy.
It’s not just that. My mother would kill me if I let something happen to him.
Don’t take this the wrong way, but did you do this for the insurance money?
No. God, you sound like the police, the firemen, my parents, my therapist and the insurance company.
We’re here for you, man. Whatever you need, okay?
Uh, actually, I was wondering if I could crash at your place for a few nights.
Sure, of course. Oh, actually, Emily was gonna spend the night.
Well, I can’t take all the credit. She let me do it to her, but, uh, but I can always call her and cancel.
Hang on. I know a place you can stay and earn some money at the same time.
I just have to warn you, it’ll involve humiliation, degradation and verbal abuse.
Boy, you chase one balloon for three miles.

No. I’ve reached my breaking point. I need to leave. Now.
So a few things don’t go your way and your best decision is to ride the rails like a hobo?
I suppose it is. Except I have a credit card. And I refuse to carry my laptop at the end of a stick. And I’d sooner die than eat beans out of a can.
Come on, come home with us and tomorrow I’ll, I’ll take you to Legoland.

Oh, come on, you know you’re overreacting.
Leonard, hang on. Just come here. Maybe we need to let him go.
It might be good for him.
You know he can’t take a trip like this by himself.
No, he looks like a grown man. You’ve seen Freaky Friday, sometimes little kids end up in big person bodies.
Leonard, we can’t protect him forever.
He’ll be okay. You taught him well, Padawan.
Good Lord. Padawan’s the student, not the teacher.
Sheldon, if you really need to do this, I’m not gonna stand in your way.
Hey. What are you guys still doing here? I got this, go. Go home.
Yeah, she’s fed, she took her pills, she’s all tucked in and watching TV.
So, she’s not too much for you?
Are you kidding? I love her, she’s great.
Stewie, you gonna watch Wheel of Fortune with me?
She insisted. So, hey, guys, thank you so much. This job is a dream come true.
Yeah. I don’t know why, but something about it feels unnatural.
Okay, Sheldon, thanks for checking in. Talk to you tomorrow? Oh, okay, bye.
Actually sounds like he’s doing pretty well.
I really think this is gonna be for the best.
Me, too. And he was able to take a sabbatical from…
How could you let him go?
